Example 2 - Let's Go Shopping

A very small bank with few employees and limited internal controls sustained significant losses due to the head teller taking money from the vault. Vault cash levels appeared a little high, so the President suggested they return some cash to the Federal Reserve. This was the trigger that identified the missing cash. As part of the outgoing currency shipment procedures, vault cash was counted and it was discovered that a number of $1 bills were stacked in the middle of the $100 bill bundles. All of these bundles had the head teller's initials on the straps. A review of the head teller's deposit account showed numerous cash deposits in hundred dollar increments. It was determined that he/she had a shopping problem with frequent online purchases that appeared to be in excess of what she could afford on her salary.
